attributes.action: stop ISPs from capping broadband connections for people only expected off piracy
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Six of the UK’s biggest net providers have agreed a plan with the music industry to tackle piracy online. The deal, negotiated by the government, will see hundreds of thousands of letters sent to net users suspected of illegally sharing music. Hard core file-sharers could see their broadband connections slowed. Broadband in UK is already a joke (your lucky if you get one half of the promised speed), now with this agreement, nothing is going stop ISPs from cutting the speed to everyone and thousands of people being treated like criminals and spyed on by their ISPs.

reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
